topic.title: Scrollspy
topic.shortdesc: Automatically update a side-bar ToC using Bootstrap navigation or list group components based on scroll position to indicate which link is currently active in the viewport.

note.p: Unlike other ToC options, scrollspy works only on embedded sub-topics within DITA files. The sidebar will not contain a topic tree based in the main ditamap.
Use the --menubar-toc.include parameter to provide an additional menu bar navigation.

section.title: Example with nested nav
section.p: Bootstrap's Scrollspy works with nested .navs. If a nested .nav is .active, its parents will also be .active. An animation of an example ToC navbar is shown below.
section.codeblock: <topic> <title>Navbar</title> ... <topic id="item1"> <title>Item 1</title> ... <topic id="item1-1" conref="..."> <title>Item 1.1</title> </topic> <topic id="item1-2" conref="..."> <title>Item 1.2</title> </topic> </topic> <topic id="item2" conref="..."> <title>Item 2</title> ... </topic> </topic>
section.p: To use this option, embed the subtopics and add the parameters --menubar-toc.include=yes and --nav-toc=nav-pill-scrollspy to the dita command.

section.title: Example with list-group
section.p: Bootstrap's Scrollspy component also works with list-groups. An animation of an example ToC menu is shown below.
section.codeblock: <topic id="item1"> <title>Item 1</title> ... <topic id="item2" conref="..."> <title>Item 2</title> </topic> <topic id="item3" conref="..."> <title>Item 3</title> </topic> </topic> <topic id="item4" conref="..."> <title>Item 4</title> </topic> </topic>
section.p: To use this option, embed the subtopics and add the parameters --menubar-toc.include=yes and --nav-toc=list-group-scrollspy to the dita command.
